page.title: 01COUNTRY AND MOTORWAY
page.content: COUNTRY AND MOTORWAY. The area is W-E transect which includes the Cotswold escarpment. In the East is the steep scarp slope, the Western area is part of the lowlands bordering the Severn estuary. Traditionally a rural area of large estates and wealthy landowners the farmland is now fragmented into smaller landholdings, with an increasing concentration on dairy farming as one approaches Bristol. There is no large settlement in the area apart from the hamlet of Codrington and no amenity except the Codrington Arms.Central to the area is the M4 Motorway which dominates the landscape when seen from the top of the escarpment at the Tormarton interchange. The impact of the M4 has been considerable,it is a West-East link, but a North-South divide.
